name: Action / Adventure
description: Fast-paced stories involving danger, battles, chases, heroic quests, or survival missions in exciting, high-stakes settings.

name: Children’s Fiction
description: Wholesome, imaginative stories written for kids featuring adventure, friendship, life lessons, and age-appropriate challenges or humor.

name: Classic Fiction
description: Timeless literary works recognized for cultural or artistic impact, often reflecting historical themes, philosophy, or human nature.

name: Contemporary Fiction
description: Realistic modern-day stories centered around everyday characters, emotions, and social issues relevant to today's world.

name: Fantasy
description: Imaginative fiction with magical worlds, mythical creatures, supernatural powers, and epic quests beyond normal reality.

name: Dark Fantasy
description: Fantasy blended with horror or grim themes; includes morally gray heroes, violence, and darker magical elements.

name: Fairy Tale
description: Whimsical stories with magical beings like fairies, witches, or talking animals, often with moral lessons or happy endings.

name: Graphic Novel
description: Narrative storytelling told visually through comic panels; may cover action, drama, fantasy, or slice-of-life with illustrations.

name: Historical Fiction
description: Fiction set in a specific historical period, blending factual settings with fictional characters, plots, or events.

name: Horror
description: Fiction that evokes fear, dread, or suspense using monsters, violence, supernatural elements, or psychological terror.

name: Body Horror
description: Disturbing horror subgenre focused on physical grotesquery, mutation, infection, or destruction of the human body.

name: Comedy Horror
description: Blends fear with humor; includes absurd, ironic, or slapstick horror where scares and laughs coexist in dark or ridiculous situations.

name: Gothic Horror
description: Atmospheric horror often set in decaying mansions or ruins, involving madness, ghosts, isolation, and ancestral secrets.

name: Lovecraftian / Cosmic Horror
description: Terror from the unknown, ancient beings, or incomprehensible cosmic forces beyond human control or understanding.

name: Paranormal Horror
description: Horror involving ghosts, vampires, hauntings, spirits, exorcisms, or supernatural forces linked to the afterlife or the occult.

name: Post‑Apocalyptic Horror
description: Set in ruined worlds after global disasters, featuring survival, mutation, desperation, and horror born from collapse.

name: Psychological Horror
description: Focuses on mental deterioration, paranoia, unreliable reality, and internal fears that distort perception and truth.

name: Quiet Horror
description: Low-key, subtle horror that relies on mood, tension, and emotional unease rather than gore or jump scares.

name: Slasher Horror
description: Gory, violent horror centered on a killer or monster stalking and brutally murdering victims, often in a predictable pattern.

name: Disaster / Survival
description: Stories or firsthand accounts of natural or human made catastrophic events like nuclear, avalanches, earthquakes, shipwrecks, wildfires, floods etc. Focuses on human endurance, emergency response, or the forces of nature.

name: Mystery / Crime / Detective
description: Stories involving solving crimes, uncovering hidden truths, or tracking down criminals through investigation or deduction.

name: Thriller / Suspense
description: Tension-filled narratives with danger, secrets, or ticking clocks; characters face deception, high stakes, or imminent threats.

name: Paranormal Thriller
description: Thrillers involving supernatural threats like ghosts, psychic powers, or occult mysteries mixed with suspense and action.

name: Romance
description: Stories centered on emotional relationships, attraction, and love; often includes personal growth, conflict, and intimacy.

name: Heist
description: Stories that center around the planning, execution, and aftermath of a theft or robbery, typically involving a skilled crew, a high-stakes target, and intricate schemes.

name: Literary Criticism
description: Analytical or evaluative writing that interprets, critiques, or theorizes about literature, its structure, context, or meaning.

name: Historical Romance
description: Romantic stories set in past eras with period-accurate settings, customs, and challenges that shape the love story.

name: Romantic Suspense
description: Blends romance with elements of mystery or danger—often involving crime, betrayal, or life-threatening situations.

name: Science Fiction
description: Speculative stories built around futuristic technology, space travel, AI, aliens, scientific discovery, or alternate realities.

name: Dystopian
description: Bleak, oppressive worlds shaped by totalitarian rule, censorship, surveillance, or environmental collapse; often involves rebellion or resistance.

name: Utopian
description: Idealized societies where problems are solved through harmony, technology, or collective values; the opposite of dystopia.

name: Space Opera
description: Epic interstellar adventure with grand battles, political intrigue, heroic quests, and high-stakes drama across galaxies.

name: Time Travel
description: Fiction involving travel through time, alternate timelines, historical shifts, paradoxes, or temporal loops.

name: Steampunk
description: Aesthetic blend of Victorian-era fashion and steam-powered technology; often features airships, inventors, and alternate history.

name: Cyberpunk
description: Dark sci-fi focused on hackers, AI, body modification, and rebellion in neon-lit, dystopian societies dominated by technology and megacorporations.

name: Speculative Fiction
description: Blends elements of science fiction, fantasy, dystopia, or the supernatural to explore alternate realities or 'what if' scenarios.

name: Literary Fiction
description: Character-driven fiction with rich prose, emotional depth, and themes that explore human nature, identity, and relationships.

name: Coming‑of‑Age
description: Stories that follow a young protagonist’s growth, self-discovery, and transition into adulthood, often marked by personal challenges.

name: Family Saga
description: Multi-generational narratives focusing on the legacy, conflict, and evolution of a family over time, often tied to historical events.

name: Urban Fiction
description: Raw, gritty storytelling rooted in modern city life, often exploring crime, class struggles, street culture, or inner-city survival.

name: Western
description: Stories set in the American frontier featuring outlaws, cowboys, lawmen, revenge, and the harsh wilderness of the Old West.

name: War
description: Fiction centered around soldiers, battles, and the impact of war—highlighting trauma, loyalty, survival, and sacrifice.

name: Tragedy
description: Serious narratives focused on downfall, moral failure, or loss—often evoking sympathy, fatalism, and deep emotional reflection.

name: Religion & Spirituality
description: Books exploring belief systems, theology, divine experiences, spiritual growth, religious practices, or comparative religion.

name: Print (Hardcover / Paperback)
description: A physical copy of a book available as hardcover or paperback for traditional reading.

name: Digital (eBook)
description: A book published in digital form, readable on devices like e-readers, phones, or tablets.

name: Audio (Audiobook)
description: Narrated version of a book designed for listening, typically read by a voice actor or the author.

name: Memoir
description: First-person narrative of a significant life period or emotional journey. Often explores trauma, survival, healing, or personal transformation.

name: Autobiography
description: A complete life story written by the subject themselves, often covering personal milestones, reflections, and historical context.

name: Self‑Help / Inspirational
description: Advice and strategies for self-improvement, confidence, productivity, mindset, and overcoming personal obstacles.

name: Business / Economics
description: Covers entrepreneurship, markets, investing, corporate strategy, economics, and financial literacy.

name: Health / Wellness
description: Books on physical and mental wellbeing, fitness, nutrition, mindfulness, and healthy living practices.

name: Politics / Civics / Government
description: Explores political theory, public policy, governance systems, elections, and contemporary civic debates.

name: Philosophy / Ethics / Spirituality
description: Explores ideas about existence, morality, belief systems, consciousness, purpose, and human thought.

name: Science & Nature
description: Nonfiction books that explain real scientific ideas like quantum physics, space, evolution, and time. Written in an accessible, often math-free style for curious readers or beginners.

name: Poetry
description: Emotional writing in verse, haiku or free-form stanzas, using metaphor, rhythm, and imagery to express themes like identity, love, grief, or longing.

name: Education / Textbook / Guide
description: Books that teach academic subjects like science, history, or math. Includes school textbooks, study guides, and educational overviews written for clarity and structured learning.

name: Journalism / Essays
description: Investigative reporting, opinion essays, and nonfiction prose on culture, events, or social commentary.

name: Travel
description: Personal narratives or guides from exploring new places, cultures, and destinations around the world.

name: Cooking / Food
description: Cookbooks, culinary essays, food culture, kitchen techniques, recipes, and ingredient-based storytelling.

name: Gardening / Crafts / DIY
description: Hands-on guides for gardening, home crafts, repairs, and creative hobbies like knitting or woodworking.

name: Art / Photography / Design
description: Visual nonfiction exploring photography, illustration, or visual art as expression or documentary.

name: Computing / Engineering / Technology
description: Nonfiction on computers, engineering, AI, programming, systems, and innovation in science and tech.

name: Sports / Fitness
description: Books on athletic performance, training, sports psychology, biographies of athletes, and fitness methods.

name: Transportation / Aviation
description: Nonfiction focused on cars, airplanes, trains, maritime travel, and the history or science of transport.

name: Architecture
description: The study of building design, city planning, structural styles, and architectural history or theory.

name: Language & Communication
description: Covers linguistics, writing skills, public speaking, language learning, and verbal or nonverbal communication.

name: Reference / Encyclopedia / Trivia
description: Factbooks, data collections, dictionaries, encyclopedias, timelines, trivia, and quick-look knowledge sources.

name: Chick Lit
description: Lighthearted fiction often centered around women navigating love, friendship, career, and personal growth with humor and charm.

name: Noir
description: Dark, gritty crime fiction with cynical characters, moral ambiguity, and bleak urban settings. Nightlife, jazz, hard-boiled, etc

name: Legal Thriller
description: Suspenseful fiction focused on lawyers, courtroom battles, legal investigations, and the pursuit of justice.

name: Political Thriller
description: Thrillers centered on espionage, government conspiracies, assassinations, and global political conflict.

name: Superhero Fiction
description: Stories with heroes or antiheroes who possess superhuman abilities and battle villains or threats to society.

name: Sword & Sorcery
description: Action-driven fantasy with warriors, magic, quests, and personal combat set in a mystical or ancient world.

name: Portal Fantasy / Isekai
description: Fiction where characters are transported from the real world into a magical or alternate universe, often via a portal.

name: Biography
description: Detailed account of another person's life, told factually with emphasis on accomplishments, struggles, and influence.

name: History
description: Analyses and narratives of past events, civilizations, wars, revolutions, and historical figures that shaped society.

name: True Crime
description: Nonfiction accounts of real criminal cases, FBI investigations, fraud, serial killers, and the justice system’s efforts to catch them.

name: Mythic Fantasy
description: Fantasy inspired by ancient myths, legends, folklore, and epic gods, often with heroic quests.

name: Middle Grade
description: Adventure and coming‑of‑age stories for pre‑teens, featuring age‑appropriate themes and humor.

name: Parenting
description: Advice, research, and personal stories on raising children, family dynamics, and child development.

name: Foreign Language Learning
description: Textbooks and guides for studying new languages, grammar, vocabulary, and conversation practice.

name: Anthropology / Sociology
description: Explores social systems, human evolution, cultural rituals, and behavioral studies of groups and societies.

name: Grimdark
description: Gritty, bleak fantasy worlds filled with moral ambiguity, violence, political corruption, and dark realism.

name: Young Adult (YA)
description: Teen-centered fiction exploring identity, first love, coming-of-age themes, school life, friends, rivals, relationships, and emotional growth.

name: Picture Book
description: Fully illustrated stories for young children, often using watercolor or soft visuals and simple text to convey heartwarming messages or gentle adventures.

name: Juvenile Fiction
description: Stories for early readers featuring straightforward plots, simple vocabulary, and foundational life lessons.

name: Food & Drink
description: Narrative and instructional nonfiction focused on cooking, ingredients, beverages, and culinary heritage.

name: Humor
description: Witty essays, comedic stories, satire, and entertaining books designed to provoke laughter or amusement.

name: Humanities & Social Sciences
description: Books exploring human culture, political thought, social systems, anthropology, ethics, and civilization studies.

name: Activity & Game Books
description: Interactive books filled with puzzles, logic games, coloring, mazes, or activities for entertainment and learning.

name: Celebrity Nonfiction
description: Memoirs, lifestyle guides, and personal stories written by or about public figures, actors, musicians, and influencers.

name: Study Aids & Test Prep
description: Educational tools, guides and practice materials designed to help with academic exams, standardized tests, and certifications.

name: Productivity / Personal Development
description: Books focused on focus, habit building, time management, goal-setting, routines, and efficiency.

name: Motivational / Success
description: Inspiring stories and mindset coaching to help readers achieve personal and professional goals with determination and vision.

name: Mindfulness / Meditation
description: Guides on practicing presence, reducing stress, meditation techniques, and cultivating inner awareness.

name: Mental Health
description: Supportive works addressing anxiety, trauma, depression, healing, emotional regulation, and therapy practices.

name: Behavioral Science
description: Books exploring how people think and act, including decision-making, biases, habits, and behavioral economics.

name: Popular Psychology
description: Accessible explanations of psychology topics such as personality, motivation, emotions, and relationships.

name: Communication / Public Speaking
description: Improving conversations, persuasion, and presentation skills. Techniques for public speaking, speech writing, and confidence building.

name: Relationships / Dating
description: Guides on emotional intimacy, healthy communication, attachment theory, dating, and romantic connection.

name: Creativity / Writing Life
description: Books for artists and writers focused on creative flow, overcoming blocks, building routines, and artistic exploration.

name: Work / Career / Leadership
description: Professional growth, workplace strategy, career planning, team building, and leadership development.

name: Startup / Entrepreneurship
description: Tactical and motivational books on launching startups, building products, funding ventures, and innovation culture.

name: Finance / Investing / Wealth
description: Guides on budgeting, wealth creation, personal finance, investing strategies, and financial independence.

name: Philanthropy / Volunteering
description: Books on charity, social impact, nonprofit work, volunteering, and creating positive change in communities.

name: Strategy / Systems / Decision Making
description: Frameworks, mental models, and decision-making tools for solving problems, analyzing systems, and planning ahead.
